availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James T. Page (Adair County deputy and circuit court clerk)

body.p: Adair County deputy and circuit court clerk. Kentucky native. Adair County deputy and circuit court clerk from at least 1860 to 1870. Household held four slaves in 1860.

bibl.p: KYR-0001-004-1309. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 2, p. 68. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Columbia, Division 2, p. 31. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Columbia, Division 2, p. 4. Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registrations, 1863-1865, Ancestry, Kentucky, Fourth Congressional District, Adair County, 1863, p. 394. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Columbia, p. 6. “James T. Page,” Find A Grave, July 25, 2010, memorial no. 55420101.
